intro: Viola boissieuana var. pseudoselkirkii, commonly known as the Selkirk viola, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features heart-shaped, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and produces striking violet-blue flowers with yellow centers. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm and thrives in cool, moist environments. It is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it forms dense mats. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to rock gardens and alpine collections.
